g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
are estimated to have greatest economic mitigation potential
that crop nutrient management has a
This value is based on GWP100 using a mixture of IPCC values for N2O and
may slightly differ if calculated using AR6 values.
The development of national roadmaps for
sustainable fertilizer (nutrient) management can help in scaling
smart villages (CSV) approach aims to generate local knowledge, with the involvement of
farmers, researchers, practitioners, and governments, on climate change adaptation and mitigation while
improving productivity, food security, and farmers'
feeds a global network that includes 36 climate
smart villages in South and Southeast Asia, West and
It is expected that agricultural production systems across the world will change in response to climate
change, posing significant challenges to the livelihoods and food security of millions of people
. Maintaining agricultural growth while minimising climate shocks is crucial to building a resilient
food production system and meeting sustainable development goals in vulnerable countries.
The CSV approach seeks an integrated vi
sion so that sustainable rural development is the final goal for
rural communities. At the same time, it fosters the understanding of climate change with the
implementation of adaptation and mitigation actions, as much as possible. Rural communities and lo
stakeholders are the leaders of this process, where scientists facilitate their knowledge to be useful for
the communities and learn at the same time about challenges but also the capacity those communities
have built through time. The portfolio includ
smart practices, and institutional/market smart activities.
The integration of technologies and services that are suitable for the local cond
gains for food security and adaptation and for mitigation where appropriate. It was also shown that, in
all regions, there is considerable yield advantage when a portfolio of technologies is used, rather than
using research results to promote their products as climate
smart leading to increases in their income
. However, climatic risk sites and socioeconomic conditions together with
lack of resource availability are key issues constraining agriculture across all five regions.
